str2: Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Apparently a participle from an otherwise obsolete derivative of the base of theros; a menial attendant.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of martus; something evidential, i.e. evidence given or, the Decalogue.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Future Participle Passive - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
